title: Cannot establish FTP connection due to unknown UTF-8 option
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When I use rclone to connect to a legacy FTP server it gets the following error message:
```
failed to make FTP connection to 'my_host': 'OPTS UTF8 ON': command not understood.
```
I'm sure the FTP server is available and works fine with other FTP clients (e.g., lftp, ftp).
An expected solution is to provide an option or config to disable UTF-8 option.

Related Option in [jlaffaye/ftp](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/jlaffaye/ftp#DialWithDisabledUTF8):
```
ftp.DialWithDisabledUTF8(true)
```


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v.158.1


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
ubuntu 18.04 (64 bit)


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
FTP


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```shell
rclone ls my_host:/
rclone lsd my_host:
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
DEBUG: ftp://myhost:21: Connecting to FTP server
Failed to create file system for "my_host:/": NewFs: failed to make FTP connection 'my_hostxxxx:21': 'OPTS UTF8 ON': command not understood.
```
